title: 10 Ways To Get Moving When You Don't Feel Like It
summary: If youâ€™re not feeling the workout on any given day, try to go with the flow. Reward yourself with a special snack or bubble bath afterward. Find a friend or group to work out with you to help you stay motivated. Use apps and fitness trackers to keep you on track and set new goals for yourself each day. Take a break and shake it off, even if you're feeling discouraged or discouraged, it can be helpful to do deep breathing exercises or take a break from your workout.

Many of us make the common resolution to exercise more. However, that can be easier said than done for some people. If you don\u2019t feel like working out one day, it doesn\u2019t mean you stop going to the gym or just give up entirely. It means you have to come up with creative ways to stay motivated and get moving when you don\u2019t feel like it.
Exercising is not always fun, but we need it to remain healthy and fit. While some people love sweating in their favorite gym class, others avoid workouts because they know how much they hate them. While exercise can be difficult at times, there are lots of different ways you can make moving more fun so that it becomes second nature and something you no longer dread.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

var g=Object.defineProperty,l=Object.defineProperties;var d=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var a=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var i=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,s=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var u=(o,e,t)=>e in o?g(o,e,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):o[e]=t,r=(o,e)=>{for(var t in e||(e={}))i.call(e,t)&&u(o,t,e[t]);if(a)for(var t of a(e))s.call(e,t)&&u(o,t,e[t]);return o},h=(o,e)=>l(o,d(e));var y=(o,e)=>{var t={};for(var n in o)i.call(o,n)&&e.indexOf(n)<0&&(t[n]=o[n]);if(o!=null&&a)for(var n of a(o))e.indexOf(n)<0&&s.call(o,n)&&(t[n]=o[n]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var n=t,{components:o}=n,e=y(n,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,h(r(r({},layoutProps),e),{components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("h2",null,"Go With The Flow"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re not feeling the workout on any given day, try to go with the flow. Don\u2019t force yourself to do something that you\u2019re not enjoying or that you\u2019re not good at just because you feel like you should. If you\u2019re trying and failing to do complicated moves that you\u2019re not good at, you\u2019ll likely end up getting frustrated and end up stopping your workout altogether.
You don\u2019t need to push yourself too hard on a given day. If you\u2019re not feeling the workout, try a few of these tips to get yourself going again.`),mdx("h2",null,"Reward Yourself"),mdx("p",null,`When you do something you don\u2019t like, such as going to the gym, it can be helpful to give yourself a reward afterward. This can be anything from a special snack, to a bubble bath, or even just a few minutes of alone time. Whatever you reward yourself with, you should only do it after completing the task, so that it is associated with that.
If you\u2019re someone who is trying to lose weight, you might not want to reward yourself with a treat like ice cream or a donut. Try to go for something a bit healthier, like a smoothie or a piece of fruit.`),mdx("h2",null,"Find A Friend Or Join A Group"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re not enjoying your workout, try finding a friend to work out with you. Working out with a friend can be a great way to help you get motivated, stay focused, and push yourself further than you would on your own.
Find someone who is at a similar fitness level to work out with you. You don\u2019t want to work out with someone who is way more fit than you, because you might not be able to keep up, and you won\u2019t get anything out of it. However, you also don\u2019t want to work out with someone who isn\u2019t at a similar fitness level as you. This can be discouraging, and you might end up holding each other back.`),mdx("h2",null,"Utilize Apps And Trackers"),mdx("p",null,"If you don\u2019t enjoy going to the gym and prefer to workout at home, try using an app or a fitness tracker to keep you on track. Apps such as My Fitness Pal, Fitbit, and Apple Health can help you track your progress and set new goals for yourself each day. Fitness trackers such as Fitbit are great for keeping track of your progress, as well as setting new goals and keeping you on track. Working out can be monotonous, so having something to keep you entertained and focused on can help you stay on task."),mdx("p",null,"If you are not working out at home, but prefer to go to the gym, try getting to the gym earlier in the day. This will help you avoid crowds and long lines, as well as having the gym all to yourself to work out."),mdx("h2",null,"Hit The Shower"),mdx("p",null,"If you aren\u2019t feeling motivated to workout at all, try getting into the shower earlier in the day. Exercising in the shower can be a great way to get your blood flowing, warm up your muscles, and get your heart rate up without even realizing it. If you do want to try exercising in the shower, make sure you don\u2019t get the water too hot, and make sure you dry off before heading back into your room."),mdx("p",null,"You can try doing some basic exercises, including lunges and squats, as well as shoulder presses, chest presses, and crunches. You can even try doing some yoga poses in the shower."),mdx("h2",null,"Take A Break And Shake It Off"),mdx("p",null,`Sometimes, you just have to shake things off, even if you\u2019re feeling super discouraged. It\u2019s not uncommon to get frustrated during a workout. If something doesn\u2019t go as planned, or you don\u2019t feel like you\u2019re making progress, it\u2019s okay to feel a bit defeated.
When you feel defeated, it can be helpful to take a short break from your workout and shake it off. Walk around the gym, or take a quick break outside. Doing some deep breathing exercises or positive affirmations can be helpful. You can try saying things such as, \u201CI am strong,\u201D or \u201CI can do this,\u201D to help you get back on track when you feel discouraged.`),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t Be Hard On Yourself"),mdx("p",null,`Exercising should be something you enjoy, not something that you dread, so try to not be so hard on yourself. If you\u2019re not enjoying a certain class, or you\u2019re just not finding the right workout for you, don\u2019t feel bad about changing things up.
If you\u2019re not enjoying the workout you\u2019re doing, it can be helpful to challenge yourself by pushing yourself a little harder. If you\u2019re not pushing yourself hard enough, it can be easy to get bored and lose interest in your workout. Throwing in some harder moves or increasing the intensity of your workout can help prevent this.`),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re not enjoying a certain class, try a new one, or even a new instructor. Not only can this help you stay motivated, but it can also help you mix things up and prevent boredom from setting in."),mdx("h2",null,"Bottom line"),mdx("p",null,"When you don\u2019t feel like going to the gym or working out, it can be easy to make an excuse as to why you can\u2019t. However, there are lots of ways to get yourself motivated and moving when you don\u2019t feel like it, even just for 10 minutes. If you don\u2019t enjoy going to the gym, find an alternative workout like yoga or hiking. There are lots of ways to get moving when you don\u2019t feel like it, you just have to find what works best for you."),mdx("p",null,"The most important thing to remember is that when you don\u2019t feel like moving, you have to make yourself do it. You\u2019re only hurting yourself by not making time for a workout, so no matter how you feel, you have to make it happen."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Create a Healthy Grocery List on a Budget

However, there are ways to make your food dollars go further and still eat well.
Instead of making weekly trips to multiple stores and markets, plan a shopping day and hit one store at a time. Look for sales in that store before you go and stock up on foods that are good value. You might even consider investing in a membership card or becoming an insider or club member so you get vouchers or other discounts. Adding your own spin on some classic cheap meals will also help you save money without sacrificing nutrition. It just takes some planning and research to make it work!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Eating a Priority

Between work, school, volunteering, and friends, it can seem like there are not enough hours in the day to get everything done. Eating well often feels like yet another thing you need to add to your endless list of responsibilities and obligations.
But making great food choices doesn\u2019t have to take up a lot of time or feel like a chore. There are lots of simple things you can do every day that will help you make eating well a top priority. You can do it anywhere and anytime. There are various affordable home workout videos available on the internet as well. However, that doesn\u2019t mean you have to break the bank when trying to save money in other areas of your life. Those at-home videos might seem like your only cheap option, but there are plenty of ways you can cut down on costs while still getting the same benefits from working out at home.
Instead of splurging on a one-time membership or an expensive series of DVDs, why not invest in some home equipment that won\u2019t cost you a fortune, but will help you get in great shape? Working out at home also has its advantages: no traffic jams and no gym membership fees! Here are 10 cheap home workout ideas for anyone who wants to slim down and tone up without breaking their budget.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Many popular fast food and casual dining establishments now offer more healthful menu selections as a response to changing tastes among customers and nutrition-conscious consumers. However, these healthier options are not necessarily the best choices when you\u2019re trying to keep your calorie intake in check.
Eatting out at restaurants, cafes, fast food chains, or any other eatery requires some advance planning if you want to keep your diet in check. The primary considerations involve choosing places that offer healthy menu offerings as well as ordering smartly once you get there. This article will assist you in making wiser decisions the next time you eat out by identifying the pitfalls of most eating establishments and providing tips on how to navigate them with less of an impact on your waistline.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

It\u2019s also one of the most difficult to maintain. With all the tempting fast food, vending machine snacks, and restaurants with cheap but high-calorie meals, it\u2019s not easy to eat right. Luckily, there are plenty of ways to make sticking to a healthy diet easier.
If you want to improve your health, increase your energy, and lose weight\u2014while still enjoying great food\u2014a healthy diet is the way to do it. A healthy diet can help prevent disease and keep you feeling great. Following these tips can get you well on your way towards meeting your nutrition goals and eating a balanced diet that will keep you happy and healthy for life.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

But working out is essential for losing weight and keeping it off. Exercise not only helps you lose weight faster and keep it off, but also improves your overall health and reduces the risk of developing chronic diseases. If you feel like hitting the gym after work isn\u2019t an option, take a look at these easy ways you can get moving in the comfort of your own home.
Working out at home has many benefits; it\u2019s convenient, cheap, private, and most importantly\u2014you can do it whenever you want! It\u2019s also a great way to strengthen your body without needing to leave the house or spend a lot of money on expensive gym memberships or personal trainers. Working out in your home not only saves you time but is also a convenient way to keep yourself motivated to stay active every day.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
